channel.title: How to Put in Custom Items?
channel.description:
[s]How do I put in custom items for a PI server? To be specific, I want to put in a set of armor in the game that I downloaded. I have a bunch of .mqo files I'm not sure where to put or what to do to make the item have a unique ID.[/s]
[b]I need GZip or something, to convert the .mqo files. I can't find one for Windows 7. I found one for windows, but it doesn't work. Anyone know where I could download one that works? Or something else that converts .mqo files to .dat?[/b]

item.title: How to Put in Custom Items?
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

First of all, I need GZip or something, to convert the .mqo files. I can’t find one for Windows 7. I found one for windows, but it doesn’t work. Anyone know where I could download one that works? Or something else that converts .mqo files to .dat

Read full topic

item.title: How to Put in Custom Items?
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

Oh…I see.

And I didn’t get any “ints” when I downloaded the models (http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,330214.msg2579832.html#msg2579832).

Read full topic
item.source: How to Put in Custom Items?

item.title: How to Put in Custom Items?
item.dc:creator: @Scaar1 Scaar
item.description:
@Scaar1 wrote:

[quote=“adamknightz, post:12, topic:381708”][quote author=Scaar link=topic=477519.msg3493867#msg3493867 date=1297131946]
wouldnt adding it just be like adding the model file then changing stuff in the item.java then compiling and redownloading the cache by reloading the client?
[/quote]
I guess…but where would I add the model files?

Most PI tutorials are on Rune-Serber.

I can’t find Rune-Serber on google.[/quote]

because rune-servber isnt a site, replace the b with a v. i dont think its allowed to be said here so i hope i didnt say too much.

and by stuff i think theyre call ints?

Read full topic
